title: A Coach’s Misconduct in 2010 Has Become a Growing Problem for Hockey in 2021
sub_head: Chicago Blackhawks video coach Brad Aldrich departed after a sexual-assault allegation. But more allegations surfaced and now his name is coming off the Stanley Cup.
body:
As video coach Brad Aldrich negotiated his exit from the Chicago Blackhawks in 2010, he made a request of the team’s human-resources department: Could he take the team’s newly won Stanley Cup to his hometown for a day?
The team agreed to let Aldrich participate in the tradition that allows every person from a Cup-winning club to have a day with the trophy. Aldrich’s name was also inscribed on the Cup alongside hundreds of others who are associated with title teams. He received a severance, playoff bonus and championship ring.
